intro: Neoceis carduifolia, commonly known as the thistleleaf neoceis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are generally spiny, resembling those of thistles, and it produces small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation in harsh climates.
